descriptors.name: iostream_eusart_baremetal
descriptors.label: Platform - I/O Stream EUSART Bare-metal
descriptors.description: This example project uses the I/O Stream service running in a bare-metal configuration to demonstrate the use of EUSART communication over the virtual COM port (VCOM). The application will echo back any characters it receives over the serial connection. The VCOM serial port can be used either over USB or by connecting to port 4902 if the kit is connected via Ethernet.

descriptors.name: mpu_simple_baremetal
descriptors.label: Platform - MPU Simple
descriptors.description: This example project demonstrates the use of the Simple MPU module. Its purpose is to block the execution of code from RAM in order to prevent code injection attacks. In this example, some fake malicious executable code is copied to RAM and executed with the MPU disabled and re-enabled to demonstrate its effectiveness.

descriptors.name: tensorflow_model_profiler
descriptors.label: Model Profiler
descriptors.description: This application is designed to profile a Tensorflow Lite Micro model on Silicon Labs hardware. The model used by the application is provided by a Tensorflow Lite flatbuffer file called model.tflite in the config/tflite subdirectory. The profiler will measure the number of CPU clock cycles and elapsed time in each layer of the model when performing an inference. It will also produce a summary when inference is done. The input layer of the model is filled with all zeroes before performing a single inference. Profiling results are transmitted over VCOM.

descriptors.name: usb_device_cdc_acm_freertos
descriptors.label: Platform - USB Device CDC ACM with FreeRTOS kernel
descriptors.description: This example uses the USB stack with the FreeRTOS kernel to create a COM port on your PC. Once connected on the port using a terminal tool, a menu is displayed and lets you echo any character you typed in.

descriptors.description: This example uses the USB stack with the Micrium OS kernel to create a COM port on your PC. Once connected on the port using a terminal tool, a menu is displayed and lets you echo any character you typed in.

descriptors.name: usb_device_composite_freertos
descriptors.label: Platform - USB Composite Device with FreeRTOS kernel
descriptors.description: This example uses the USB stack with the FreeRTOS kernel to create a composite device.

descriptors.description: This example uses the USB stack with the Micrium OS kernel to create a composite device.

descriptors.name: usb_device_hid_freertos
descriptors.label: Platform - USB Device HID with FreeRTOS kernel
descriptors.description: This example uses the USB stack HID Class with the FreeRTOS kernel to emulate a mouse. Once the usb device is connected to a computer, it will trigger continuous mouse mouvements.

descriptors.description: This example uses the USB stack HID Class with the MicriumOS kernel to emulate a mouse. Once the usb device is connected to a computer, it will trigger continuous mouse mouvements.

descriptors.name: voice_control_light
descriptors.label: Voice Control Light
descriptors.description: This application uses TensorFlow Lite for Microcontrollers to detect the spoken words "on" and "off" from audio data recorded on the microphone in a Micrium OS kernel task. The detected keywords are used to control an LED on the board.

descriptors.name: wifi_commissioning_micriumos
descriptors.label: Platform - Wi-Fi Commissioning on Micrium OS kernel
descriptors.description: Demonstrates how to setup a Wi-Fi station using the WF200 Wi-Fi station/softAP combo feature. The application exposes a Wi-Fi access point and a web server to configure the station.
